definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: The new owner transformed the old house into a showplace.
sentences.chinese: 新主人把那幢旧房子装修得富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: The portal of the mansion looks magnificent.
sentences.chinese: 这座大厦的正门看上去富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: Here let me say that there is no magnificence about this suite of rooms.
sentences.chinese: 在这儿容许我说一下，房间的装潢绝不富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: The East Stand, for all its magnificence also has a controversial past.
sentences.chinese: 富丽堂皇的东看台也有着备受争议的历史。

sentences.english: A handsome grilled gateway opens to the garden of all desired things.
sentences.chinese: 通向渴望之园的那扇富丽堂皇的格栅门大敞开着。

sentences.english: They may also amuse themselves in the magnificent Workers Palace of Culture.
sentences.chinese: 他们也可以在富丽堂皇的工人文化宫里消遣娱乐。
宫殿被装饰得富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: This magnificent flower plants, where a scholar like the Poor?
sentences.chinese: 这株花富丽堂皇，那里像个落第秀才了？

sentences.english: Seated, the bronze table setting gives you a sense of palace grandeur.
sentences.chinese: 就座后，铜质的餐具彰显着宫殿般的富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: St. George's Hall was splendidly decorated.
sentences.chinese: 圣乔治堂被布置得富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: There were a lot of majestic old stone buildings in Antwerp.
sentences.chinese: 安特卫普市里有着很多富丽堂皇的石造古老建筑物。

sentences.english: Mecca already boasts dozens of fancy international hotels.
sentences.chinese: 麦加为已拥有数十家富丽堂皇的国际酒店而自豪。

sentences.english: Both the pilasters and eaves are engraved with flowers, these really are fabulous.
sentences.chinese: 壁柱和瓦檐均雕花刻画，富丽堂皇。

sentences.english: Sumptuous hotel lobbies, highlight-star hotel luxury style.
sentences.chinese: 富丽堂皇的酒店大堂，彰显星级酒店的豪华气派。

sentences.english: And is this splendid castle also yours, my lord Marquis of Carabas?
sentences.chinese: 这富丽堂皇的城堡也是你的吗，我的了拉巴斯侯爵？

definition: gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
